business.headline: Errors in ITR filing? 3 simple ways to fix it: Revise, rectify or updateWorried about spotting a mistake in your ITR after filing? You're not alone. Errors happen to many taxpayers. Thankfully, the system gives you not one but three ways to fix them. Let's have a look.

Should you still bet on IT stocks as H-1B visa worries resurface?The US move on H-1B visa has stirred fears of rising costs and tighter restrictions on tech firms that rely on sending skilled workers to client locations.

GST 2.0 rate cut: Groceries, electronic items get cheaper this festive seasonThis report examines the impact of GST rate changes on household budgets, focusing on groceries and electronics. Items like chocolates and shampoos are now cheaper, with shampoos moving from an 18% to a 5% tax bracket. In contrast, aerated drinks are subject to a 'sin tax'. The report highlights significant savings, noting, "an average saving of 10% will mean 5000 rupees per month saving" for a consumer with a monthly income of one lakh rupees. The changes are presented as a "festive gift from the Modi government," with major electronics also seeing price drops. Televisions over 32 inches, previously in a 28% slab, are now taxed at 18%, resulting in substantial savings for consumers looking to upgrade. Washing machines, refrigerators, and dishwashers also benefit from a 10% tax reduction.

Live: GST 2.0 kicks off, BJP urges traders to pass on relief to consumersThe GST Council has approved major tax reforms effective today, September 22, introducing a simplified two-rate structure of 5% and 18% to ease compliance and lower costs. Essential items like soaps, shampoos, bicycles, and packaged foods will now attract 5% GST, while appliances such as ACs and large TVs will be taxed at 18%, down from 28%. Luxury and sin goods, including tobacco and high-end cars, will continue to face a 40% levy plus compensation cess. Follow Indiatoday.in for latest updates.

Tech Mahindra, TCS, Infosys: Why are IT stocks falling today?Tech Mahindra was the worst hit, sliding nearly 5% in early trade. Infosys, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), HCLTech and Wipro also fell more than 2.5% each. The Nifty IT index shed almost 3%, making it one of the day's worst-performing sectoral indices.
Sensex down 346 points, Nifty below 25,300; Tech Mahindra tanks 6%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 267.56 points to 82,358.67, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 48.60 points to 25,278.45​​​​​​​ as of 9:25 am.

Kunal Bahl, rejected for H-1B, consoles techies: I did well in India, didn't I?While India has long been the biggest beneficiary of H-1B visas, accounting for 71% of all approvals last year, uncertainty has cast a shadow over careers, education plans and the information technology industry.

GST 2.0 kicks in: What changes in your shopping bill from today Live UpdatesThe government expects GST 2.0 to reduce compliance challenges, cut disputes, and make goods and services cheaper for households. Read on to know which items get cheaper and which turn costlier from today.

GST 2.0 comes into effect: What's cheaper and costlier from todayAs the new rates under GST 2.0 come into effect from Monday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the reforms will boost savings for households, farmers, shopkeepers, and businesses.

ITR refund under processing? Here's how to check status and what to do nextIf your refund remains under processing, first ensure your ITR has been e-verified, as refunds cannot be processed without this step. You can also check Form 26AS to verify if the refund has already been credited to your account.

From grocery runs to gym sessions: What today's homebuyers really wantToday's urban buyers want more than a home, they seek a lifestyle where comfort, convenience, and community come together, and daily needs, work, and wellness coexist effortlessly.

Piyush Goyal to visit US for trade talks on September 22 amid tariff, H-1B tensionsThe minister will visit New York and will be accompanied by special secretary in the ministry Rajesh Agrawal and other officials.

entertainment.headline: If Hollywood has Tom Cruise, we have Akshay Kumar, says Mahesh BhattBollywood's Akshay Kumar is hailed as an action hero on par with Hollywood's Tom Cruise, following a daring stunt in the film 'Angaaray' that left director Mahesh Bhatt in awe. He earned high praise on 'The Kapil Sharma Show' finale.

Anu Malik says Zubeen Garg suffered blackouts, shares his devotion to social issuesSinger Zubeen Garg's death led to widespread mourning across Assam and the music industry. Composer Anu Malik remembered working with Garg and recalled his health struggles during his Bollywood years.

Nagaland minister slams student's comment on Zubeen Garg: He was Northeast's prideA Nagaland minister recently criticised Naga students' remarks about singer Zubeen Garg at Kaziranga University.  He called him the pride of Northeast.

Tom Holland suffers concussion on Spider-Man Brand New Day set, filming haltedBritish actor Tom Holland sustained a mild concussion on 'Spider-Man: Brand New Day' set. The film's production has been paused for several days as a precaution.

Jolly LLB 3 box office Day 3: Akshay's film gets franchise's biggest 1st weekend'Jolly LLB 3' recorded a solid opening weekend in India. The Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi-starrer legal comedy is doing better than its predecessors in the franchise. This is a promising sign, but Monday will tell us more about its long-time potential at the box office.

Kajol reveals the acting trick that helped her nail a DDLJ sceneKajol shares her unique acting method that helps her perform challenging scenes with conviction. She explains how momentarily believing in a character keeps her performances authentic yet true to herself.

Actor Radhika Sarathkumar's mother Geetha dies, funeral in Chennai todayActor Radhika Sarathkumar's mother, Geetha Radha, died at the age of 86 on Sunday night. Her funeral will be held at 4.30 pm at Besant Nagar Crematorium in Chennai.

Mohanlal to play cameo in Akshay Kumar-Saif's Haiwaan, confirms PriyadarshanMohanlal will appear in a cameo in the upcoming thriller 'Haiwaan'. Director Priyadarshan confirmed his casting in a recent interview.

Zubeen Garg wanted his final rites to be held by Brahmaputra riverAs fans share their condolences, an old interview of late singer Zubeen Garg is going viral in which he expressed how he wanted to spend his final time. The 52-year-old died in Singapore on September 19 during a sea outing.

Kareena Kapoor turns 45, Karisma, Soha, Neetu extend wishes to ultimate glam queenActor Kareena Kapoor Khan celebrated her 45th birthday on September 21, 2025. She received warm birthday wishes from family and friends on her special day.

Dulquer Salmaan dismisses reports of Lokah OTT release, asks what's the hurryAs 'Lokah' continues to rule the box office, actor Dulquer Salmaan has shut down reports surrounding its OTT release in the near future. The film has earned over Rs 200 crore worldwide.

general news.headline: Unfortunate: Supreme Court on 'pilot error' mention in Air India crash reportThe Supreme Court, while responding to a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) seeking an independent, court-monitored probe into the Air India plane crash, observed that it was "irresponsible" to blame pilots based on a preliminary inquiry report.

Why Modi's big bet is now on India's middle class, not big corporatesAfter the income tax relief, the GST rate rationalisation will leave more money in the hands of India's middle class, which will, in turn, boost India's consumption-driven economy. The Modi government is placing a big bet on small consumers after large corporates pocketed tax-break gains.

Bihar polls likely to be held in 3 phases from November 5-15The current Assembly's term will end on November 22, 2025, and the poll panel is required to complete the election process before that date.

Trump admin linking paracetamol use in pregnancy to autism in kidsThe Trump administration is preparing to announce a link between the use of paracetamol during pregnancy and an increased risk of autism, according to reports. However, medical guidelines so far have shown that paracetamol is safe for use in pregnancy.

Is Rahul Gandhi talking of Gen Z only after Nepal protests? Here's the truthCongress leader Rahul Gandhi's appeal to India's Gen Z, just days after Nepal's youth-led protest toppled PM KP Oli's regime, was slammed by the BJP for trying to "engineer a Nepal-like unrest". But his outreach to India's digital-savvy generation predates the Nepal crisis. However, the context of the reference to India's Gen Z population was different then.

His inability to find fluency or accelerate left fans frustrated as Pakistan posted 171 for 5.

Jasprit Bumrah expensive vs Pakistan, fans question if he's fully fitAsia Cup 2025 IND vs PAK: Jasprit Bumrah conceded 34 runs in three overs in the powerplay as Pakistan scored 55 runs. Despite losing Fakhar Zaman, Pakistan got off to a good start in their Super 4 match.

Horror fielding show? India drop 3 catches against Pakistan in Super 4 clashIndia's poor fielding allowed Pakistan to get a strong start in the Asia Cup Super 4 clash at Dubai. The fielding lapses put India under pressure and drew criticism from fans on social media.

Fakhar Zaman shocked after tight Sanju Samson catch in Super 4Fakhar Zaman was left stunned after scoring 15 off nine balls before being dismissed by Hardik Pandya in India's Asia Cup 2025 Super 4 clash. The wicket, confirmed by the third umpire after an uncertain catch by Sanju Samson, left both Fakhar and Pakistan coach Mike Hesson visibly frustrated.

Japan bids teary farewell as Fraser-Pryce passes the baton to Jefferson-WoodenJapan gave a heartfelt farewell to sprint queen Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce as she ran the final race of her career. She passed the symbolic baton to USA's Melissa Jefferson-Wooden who swept the sprint triple.

No Arshdeep Singh as India bring back Jasprit Bumrah and Varun ChakravarthyIndia have fielded Jasprit Bumrah and Varun Chakravarthy for their Asia Cup 2025 Super 4 clash against Pakistan, replacing Arshdeep Singh and Harshit Rana.
